A. Neuroscience & Neuroanatomy.definition: Brain and nervous-system structures, neural anatomy, cell types, and anatomical pathways.

B. Neuropharmacology & Biochemistry.definition: Neurochemicals, neurotransmitters, receptors, intracellular signaling molecules, and pharmacological agents.

C. Neurophysiology & Brain Activity.definition: Electrical and physiological brain activity, oscillations, evoked potentials, and electrophysiological measures.

D. Brain Stimulation & Intervention.definition: Noninvasive or invasive neuromodulation and stimulation techniques.

E. Motor Skills & Performance.definition: Skilled movement activities, sports, artistic performance, and motor abilities.

F. Motor Control & Execution.definition: Mechanics and control of movement, including kinematics, dynamics, forces, and muscle activation.

G. Motor Learning: General/Theory.definition: Theoretical concepts of motor skill learning, memory, acquisition, and performance change.

H. Motor Learning: Mechanisms & Factors.definition: Specific variables that influence motor learning, including feedback, schedule, difficulty, and instruction.

I. Implicit vs. Explicit Learning.definition: Awareness, cognitive load, and the distinction between conscious and unconscious learning processes.

J. Sensory & Perceptual Systems.definition: Sensory modalities and perceptual processes including proprioception, tactile, auditory, visual, and multisensory.

K. Plasticity & Adaptation.definition: Neural plasticity mechanisms, adaptation, synaptic changes, and reorganization.

L. Cognition & Executive Function.definition: Cognitive processes such as attention, working memory, decision-making, reasoning, and inhibition.

M. Computational & Modeling.definition: Mathematical models, machine learning, neural networks, optimization, and computational analyses.

N. Robotics & Technology.definition: Robotics, devices, sensors, virtual reality systems, interfaces, and assistive technologies.

O. Clinical Conditions & Disease Models.definition: Neurological, psychiatric, developmental, metabolic, and medical disorders or disease states.

P. Rehabilitation & Therapy.definition: Therapeutic interventions, rehabilitation programs, clinical treatments, and recovery protocols.

Q. Psychological Factors & Motivation.definition: Emotional, motivational, psychological, and affective influences on behavior and learning.

R. Timing & Rhythm.definition: Temporal aspects of movement and perception, including rhythm, timing, and reaction time.

S. Research Methodology & Statistics.definition: Experimental design, statistical analysis, measurement tools, and research methods.

T. Human & Animal Subjects.definition: Human and animal populations used in research, including demographic descriptors.

U. Vision & Oculomotor Control.definition: Visual processing and control of eye movements.

V. Speech & Language.definition: Speech production, language processing, communication, and vocal articulation.

W. Development & Lifespan.definition: Developmental stages, aging, maturation, and lifespan-related processes.

X. Imaging & Assessment Techniques.definition: Imaging, recording, measurement, and quantitative assessment tools.

Z. Unclassified.definition: Terms that do not fit scientific, neurological, motor, clinical, or methodological domains.
